title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SAN FRANCISCO – History was not made by a team on this night, but by one man. Tim Hardaway, in a stunning and dominant individual performance, authored a masterpiece against his former club, pouring in a career-high 42 points to single-handedly incinerate the Golden State Warriors, 107-88.

From the opening tip, Hardaway was a man possessed. There was no answer for his blinding crossover, his feathery touch from beyond the arc, or his relentless drives into the heart of the defense. The Oakland Arena, once his home court, could only watch in awe and frustration as he systematically dismantled the Warriors.

Each quarter was another chapter in his personal highlight reel. While Alonzo Mourning provided a formidable interior presence with 17 points and 13 rebounds, the night belonged unequivocally to the Miami point guard. The Warriors, led by Joe Smith’s 19 points, simply had no counter for the hurricane named "Timsanity."

The final score was a mere formality, a lopsided result born entirely from one of the most spectacular offensive outbursts of the season. Hardaway’s 42 points were not just a number on a stat sheet; they were a statement—a roaring declaration of his arrival as an elite scorer and a devastating reminder to the franchise that once let him go. On this night, the Heat didn’t just win a road game; they rode the coattails of a legend in the making.
